name: hesperetine
Reason: 1,1'-Terphenyl has a melting point of 205 degrees Celsius. The presence of three phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +60°C per group, totaling +180°C. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The methoxy group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +10°C. The thiadiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +10°C. The presence of three phenyl groups, two methoxy groups, and one thiadiazole ring contribute to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The methoxy group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +10°C. The thiadiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +10°C.
